channel.title: First team project -?
channel.description:
So I think that we should make a team project to get the community going.
Possibly create question threads we wouldn't even really need answers to [team member A asks a question that they probably already know the answer to, team member B replies] so that people can see what sort of stuff should go in each section?
I like the idea of space invaders/Galaga using Slick2D (to show how it would be used). It wouldn't take to long, it's fairly well known, and it's not that complicated.

item.title: First team project -?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:


My progress so far

Probably need to find a better bg :\

Read full topic

item.title: First team project -?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

For a Java game ready to run, there is always checkers:

https://www.moparisthebest.com/checkers.php

And the source code:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/checkers.tar.gz

I think I wrote that in my second programming class of all time? Would that be helpful to anyone?

Read full topic

item.title: First team project -?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Lol we really should have waited to announce, tutorials should have been made first. People come here for the tutorials, love the results and want to keep going, end up asking for help and helping those below them etc. Right now we have nothing to offer Ben you better pick a game fast to make and document DO MINE!! http://gamedev.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,512747.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: First team project -?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I suppose, but I don’t really know why you would, it would probably be better to start from scratch. I will post them with instructions later though.

Read full topic

item.title: First team project -?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:411303”]Here is tetris:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Of course that ‘sleep’ issue should be fixed with some #ifdef’s. Meh.

The Panda3d examples are more complicated, since you need to have python and panda3d installed, and I think it’s been under heavy development, so who knows if what I did was deprecated by now?..[/quote]

We could always rewrite them in Java, too. I’d use LWJGL as a replacement for panda3d (though I’m not sure how much of panda3d is engine-specific). Could always use JME, too.

Read full topic

item.title: First team project -?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Here is tetris:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Of course that ‘sleep’ issue should be fixed with some #ifdef’s. Meh.

The Panda3d examples are more complicated, since you need to have python and panda3d installed, and I think it’s been under heavy development, so who knows if what I did was deprecated by now?..

Read full topic

item.title: First team project -?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I have quite a handful of smallish rather simplistic games I could post that were assignments from my college days. Some I’ve posted before on moparisthebest.com, others I haven’t. Some are written in straight C++ using OpenGL, others Java, others in Python using Panda3d. I don’t know if they would be of any help unless someone wanted to go through and document them or something?

Could you maybe post them in this section? We could document them and repost them later on.

Read full topic

item.title: First team project -?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:2, topic:411303”]Not sure how that would role, I look forward more to being buffed up with tutorials.[/quote]I know we cleared this up on IRC, but yea I’ll be making tutorials on how I make the game as I go (well probably once I finish, because you never know what changes as you rewrite)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Not sure how that would role, I look forward more to being buffed up with tutorials. Perhaps you could help fuel the tool community while we wait for Taharok and Spel to get some good development tutorials going?

Read full topic
